name: keenly
content:
keenly adverb
(EXTREMELY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
extremely or very strongly: They are keenly aware that this will be their last chance to succeed.
More examplesFewer examplesBoth are keenly interested, but have not provided plans. She still keenly feels the loss of her first child. His death affected me keenly, for we had been good friends. NASA scientists were keenly disappointed when the Voyager 1 spacecraft flew by Titan in 1980.The match promises to be a keenly contested affair. His keenly intelligent mind and passion for building systems helped him create an entirely new company.

keenly adverb
(CAREFULLY)
If you look at someone or something keenly, you watch them very closely, and notice every detail. : He grunted a reply, and eyed me keenly from head to foot.
More examplesFewer examplesThe child advanced timidly towards her brother and glanced keenly at all present.While the women talked, he was keenly watching.If we observe nature keenly, we see how divine wisdom is working. His dark eyes were keenly following every move that they were making.
